page.title: 02Badsell Park Farm Matfield.
page.content: The 18th century farmhouse was once the Earl of Westmoreland's hunting lodge. It is a fruit and arable farm covering{185}acres,with 100 acres of wheat,13 of strawberries,25 of apples and 1 of blackberries. There are only {2}full time workers and{1}part time worker who is self employed. During seasonal picking times about{25}casual workers are employed. The present owners have lived there 20 years and work on a{land rotation {plan}that always looks {5 years ahead. They have established a"Pick Your Own" aspect to the farm so that the public can gather fruit in the appropriate seasons. In an effort to bring a greater understanding of farming to the general public farmers are being encouraged to open their farms.Keen to nurture this idea, a{farm trail and {pet area}has been created, see page 3.
